item.content:encoded: Per Moody's, the top 10% of earners now account for nearly half of all spending in the United States. If only there was some policy that would allow us to diversify income and spending across a broader swath of Americans. Oh well. Guess capitalism just has to be this way.

item.content:encoded: Former M&A Director of Constellation Software's on the deal sourcing process $csu "They have a database of around 70,000 or however many software companies. Basically, every software company in the world is included."

item.author: BuccoCapital Bloke

item.content:encoded: Spotify's advertising revenue grew by 7% (y/y) in Q4, compared to 17% for Meta, 14% for Snap, 14% for YouTube, and 18% for Pinterest. While the company does offer a pixel, it has struggled to activate it for effective targeting, given the specifics of the ad format.
item.author: Eric Seufert

item.content:encoded: Chegg CEO: Google‚Äôs AI Overviews have significantly impacted Chegg‚Äôs traffic, acquisitions & revenue "Our non- subscriber traffic plummeted to negative 49% in January 2025, down significantly from the modest 8% decline we reported in Q2 2024" $CHGG: -27% AH
item.author: The Transcript

item.content:encoded: This is insane. If you wonder why some of us think the rule of law is about to fall, it's this. The U.S. Attorney for DC is not "President Trump's lawyer" and its job is not to "protect his leadership" nor prosecute people who "refuse to put America first".

item.content:encoded: Is missing your next quarter's revenue guide by ALMOST 20%(!!), suing Google, and announcing a strategic review a good thing? It doesn't seem good, but you just never know. $CHGG

item.content:encoded: Jitse buying GRUB and then thinking he could spend Uber Eats out of the UK with his German/Dutch profit pools has to be one of the craziest strategies of all time. January the first month where JET isn't #1 in the UK. Hard to believe.

item.content:encoded: $HIMS is a SPICY meatball. Lots going on in the business and tough to model. Subscribers grew 45% yy to 2.2m. Rev accelerated to 95% yy to 482m driven by GLPs (both >3x more expensive than base subscriptions but also mostly selling 6-12 months of subscription up front ‚Äì

item.content:encoded: Introducing Claude 3.7 Sonnet: our most intelligent model to date. It's a hybrid reasoning model, producing near-instant responses or extended, step-by-step thinking. One model, two ways to think. We‚Äôre also releasing an agentic coding tool: Claude Code.

item.content:encoded: Intel is using the latest ASML high NA EUV lithography machines now, with early production data ‚Äúindicating they are more reliable than earlier models,‚Äù Reuters reports, citing Intel senior principal engineer Steve Carson, who put output at 30,000 wafers so far. 1/2 $ASML $INTC
